FuncDef:
The vrrp vrid interface command binds an inter-chassis backup group to a VRRP backup group.
The undo vrrp vrid interface command unbinds an inter-chassis backup group from a VRRP backup group.
By default, a inter-chassis backup group is not bound to any VRRP backup group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a VRRP backup group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Specifies the type of the interface on which a VRRP backup group resides.
Currently, the GE interface, GE sub-interface, Eth-Trunk interface, Eth-Trunk sub-interface, and loopback interface are supported.

Specifies the number of the interface on which a VRRP backup group resides.
-

Specifies the name of the interface on which a VRRP backup group resides.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To bind an inter-chassis backup group to a VRRP backup group, run the vrrp vrid interface command. This command is applicable only to inter-chassis hot backup scenarios, but not inter-board hot backup scenarios.
Prerequisites
VRRP has been configured in an inter-chassis hot backup scenario.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S in inter-chassis hot backup scenarios.
